FDG.function_description: Settings page for app customization options

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Settings page. They can click the back navigation arrow (at step S1) to navigate back, with the destination page remaining the same (likely reloading or confirming the back action). There are no branches or loops as only one action is defined.

FDG.function_description: The "About" page for the OpenLauncher app provides information about the app's version, links to its GitHub repository and open - source libraries, an option to rate the app, and details about the OpenLauncher team members and contributors.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Settings page. First, click the information icon (on the Settings page) to navigate to the About page. Then, on the About page, click the OpenLauncher title; this action does not change the page (stays on About).

steps.summary: Click information icon on Settings page to open About page
Click OpenLauncher title on About page (page remains)

FDG.function_description: The Desktop settings page allows users to configure various desktop - related options, including minibar items, desktop style, grid size, and the visibility of elements like the search bar, fullscreen mode, desktop indicator, and app/folder labels.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Settings page. They click the 'Desktop' option to navigate to the Desktop settings page, where various desktop - related configuration options (like minibar, style, grid size, and element visibility) are available for further interaction.

steps.summary: Click on the Desktop settings option to enter the Desktop settings page.

FDG.function_description: The Dock settings page allows users to configure the dock size and toggle the visibility of app and folder names within the dock.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main settings page. They click the 'Dock' settings option, which navigates to the Dock settings page where they can configure dock size and label visibility. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click on the Dock settings option to navigate to the Dock settings page.

FDG.function_description: The App Drawer settings page allows users to configure various aspects of the app drawer, including its style, grid size, background, search functionality, page memory, and scrollbar visibility.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main Settings page. They click the 'App Drawer' option, which navigates to the App Drawer settings page where various configuration options (style, grid size, background, search, page memory, scrollbar) are available for interaction.

steps.summary: Click on 'App Drawer' option in Settings to navigate to App Drawer settings page

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to configure various gesture-based actions (e.g., single click, double click, pinch, unpinch, swipes) and toggle the "Fast swipe drawer" feature to customize how gestures interact with the app.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'Gestures' settings option (from the main settings page) to enter the Gestures configuration page. From there, the user can choose to configure specific gesture actions: either click the 'Pinch' action option or the 'Swipe up' action option (each leading to their respective configuration dialogs for customizing the gestureâ€™s behavior).

steps.summary: Click 'Gestures' settings to enter gesture config page
Click 'Pinch' action to configure its behavior
Click 'Swipe up' action to configure its behavior

FDG.function_description: The Colors settings page allows users to configure the background and label colors for various UI components including the dock, drawer background, drawer card, folders, and folder/app drawer labels.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the Colors settings page. From there, users can select a UI component (dock, drawer background, etc.) to configure its color. For each component, users can choose a preset color, adjust a custom color via hex input/sliders, or use presets. After configuring, they can confirm (OK) to apply or cancel to exit without changes. The process repeats for other components as needed.

steps.summary: Configure custom color via hex input

FDG.function_description: The current page (Icons settings) allows users to customize app icon size, select an installed icon pack, and hide selected apps from the launcher.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Settings page. They click the 'Icons' settings option, which navigates to the Icons settings page. This page provides options to customize app icon size, select an icon pack, or hide apps from the launcher.

steps.summary: Click on 'Icons' settings option to navigate to Icons settings page

FDG.function_description: The current page, labeled "Other" within the app's settings, provides options to backup and restore app settings and to restart the launcher if it is malfunctioning.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Settings page. The user clicks the 'Other' option, navigating to the 'Other' settings page, where options for backup/restore and launcher restart are available. No branches or loops are present in this initial navigation step.

steps.summary: Click 'Other' option in Settings to navigate to Other settings page

FDG.function_description: The page provides detailed information about the OpenLauncher app, including its version, links to GitHub and open - source libraries, an option to rate the app, and details about the Open Launcher Team members and contributors.
